title: How to Extract Pages from a PDF Document to Create a New One

steps.title: Open the PDF
steps.content: Open the PDF file in Google Chrome. If Google Chrome isn't your default PDF viewer, right-click (or Command-click) the file, click Open with , and then select Google Chrome .

steps.title: Click the Print icon.
steps.content: Click the Print icon. This is in the top-right corner of the page. A printing menu will open.

steps.title: Set "Destination" as Save as PDF.
steps.content: Set "Destination" as Save as PDF . Click the drop-down menu to see more options. If you have other printers connected, you'll also see them here.

steps.title: Set "Pages" as Custom.
steps.content: Set "Pages" as Custom . Click the drop-down menu to see more options. By default, this will be preset to All . Alternatively, you can select Odd pages only or Even pages only .

steps.title: Specify the pages you want to save.
steps.content: Specify the pages you want to save. You only need to include the pages you want to keep; don't include the pages you want to remove. For example, to keep all pages except 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 13 from a 20-page document, enter the following: 1-3, 5, 10-12, 14-20

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . This is the blue button at the bottom. A pop-up window will open.

steps.title: Select a save location and click Save.
steps.content: Select a save location and click Save . For some devices, the default location may be set to the Downloads folder. The new PDF will be saved to your computer.

steps.title: Open the PDF file.
steps.content: Open the PDF file. By default, it should open in your preferred browser. You can use Windows' built-in Microsoft Print to PDF feature to extract pages from a document.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+P.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + P . This will open the Print menu.

steps.title: Click the "Destination" drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the "Destination" drop-down menu. You'll see a list of available printers and other destinations.

steps.title: Click Microsoft Print to PDF.
steps.content: Click Microsoft Print to PDF . This will be listed in the drop-down menu. If you don't see this option, do the following to enable it: Open the Start menu. Type "turn windows features on or off". Click the first option. Check the box next to Microsoft Print to PDF . Click OK .

steps.title: Set "Pages" as Custom.
steps.content: Set "Pages" as Custom . Click the drop-down menu to see more options. By default, this will be preset to All . Alternatively, you can select Current , Odd , or Even .

steps.title: Specify the pages you want to save.
steps.content: Specify the pages you want to save. You only need to include the pages you want to keep; don't include the pages you want to remove. For example, to keep all pages except 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 13 from a 20-page document, enter the following: 1-3, 5, 10-12, 14-20

steps.title: Click Print.
steps.content: Click Print . This is the button at the bottom of the screen. A new window will open.

steps.title: Select a save location and click Save.
steps.content: Select a save location and click Save . The new PDF will be saved to your computer.

steps.title: Open the PDF file.
steps.content: Open the PDF file. By default, it should open in the Preview app. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press ⌘ Command+P.
steps.content: Press ⌘ Command + P . This will open the Print menu.

steps.title: Set "Pages" as Selected Pages in Sidebar.
steps.content: Set "Pages" as Selected Pages in Sidebar . By default, this will be preset to All . Alternatively, you can select Single or Range .

steps.title: Select the pages you want to keep.
steps.content: Select the pages you want to keep. Click the thumbnails in the sidebar to select them. If you don't want a page in the new saved document, make sure it's deselected.

steps.title: Click the down arrow next to "PDF".
steps.content: Click the down arrow next to "PDF". This is towards the bottom of the menu. You'll see a list of options.

steps.title: Select Save as PDF.
steps.content: Select Save as PDF . This will be listed in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Edit the information (optional).
steps.content: Edit the information (optional). You can change the title, author, subject, and keywords if necessary. To change the location, click the Where drop-down menu and select a new location.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . The new PDF file will be saved. You can also enter information such as the Title, Subject, and Keywords to make the file easier to find later.

steps.title: Open Adobe Acrobat.
steps.content: Open Adobe Acrobat . This is a paid program that allows you to extract pages from a PDF. [2] X Research source This feature is not available in the free version of Adobe Acrobat (Reader).

steps.title: Click the Organize Pages tool.
steps.content: Click the Organize Pages tool. You can find this in the right toolbar or the Tools menu.

steps.title: Click Select a File.
steps.content: Click Select a File . A pop-up window will open.

steps.title: Open the PDF you want to edit.
steps.content: Open the PDF you want to edit. Use the pop-up window to find the file, then click Open .

steps.title: Click Extract.
steps.content: Click Extract . This is at the top of the page.

steps.title: Select the pages you want to extract.
steps.content: Select the pages you want to extract. When you click a page, it will be highlighted.

steps.title: Click Extract.
steps.content: Click Extract . This is the blue button at the top.

steps.title: Save the new PDF.
steps.content: Save the new PDF. The new pages will open in a new tab. To save it as a new document, go to File and click Save As . Select a save location. The new PDF will be saved to your computer.
